If all diseases were cured, the world population would likely increase significantly due to longer lifespans and improved overall health. This could lead to overpopulation and strain on resources, such as food, water, and energy.

The healthcare industry would be transformed, with many hospitals and medical professionals becoming obsolete. People would have more time and resources to focus on other areas of their lives, such as education, career, and hobbies.
The cost of healthcare would decrease significantly, freeing up more money for individuals and governments to invest in other areas, such as education, infrastructure, and research.
The prevalence of mental health issues, such as depression and anxiety, could increase as people have more time to reflect on their lives and their place in the world.

The concept of mortality would become lessicting, and people would have more time to pursue their dreams and goals. This could lead to a more creative and innovative society, as people have more time to think and explore new ideas.
